items.sentence: I\'m considering studying in the United States next year.
I\'m not even going to try to get Tom to stop doing that.
I\'m not sure what it was, but it sounded like a gunshot.
I\'m sorry to have kept you waiting for such a long time.
I can try to forget, but I don\'t think I\'ll be able to.
I can\'t live without you. You\'re the only woman for me.
Tom told Mary a joke, but she didn\'t think it was funny.
It\'s a pity we didn\'t visit Tom when we had the chance.
It\'s up to you to decide whether we\'ll go there or not.
Tom didn\'t expect to sell his old car for so much money.
Tom didn\'t tell you about what happened to Mary, did he?
I think Tom looked better before he shaved off his beard.
Tom didn\'t have the courage to ask his boss for a raise.
Tom didn\'t have to tell me twice what needed to be done.
Tom didn\'t know that Mary was studying French with John.
Mary reached inside her purse and pulled out her license.
Mary snuggled up to Tom and put her arms around his neck.
Mary took her key out of her purse and unlocked the door.
Mary was the only girl Tom ever talked to in high school.
I tried to convince myself I hadn\'t done anything wrong.
